intro: Adenosma glutinosa, commonly known as sticky adenosma, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its sticky leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Adenosma glutinosa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
